value:
Forma Allies:
After the Hall of Forms, you can
exchange Forma Souls to gain
Forma units as allies.

Forma Souls:
Forma Souls will be periodically
available for purchase in the Shop.

What Forma Allies Keep:
Forma Allies will keep the skills
and levels they earn within the
Hall of Forms.

What Forma Allies Lose:
Forma Allies will lose the merges
and Sacred Seals they earn within
the Hall of Forms.

Forma Restrictions:
Forma cannot be used as the
source for merges or Inherit Skill,
nor can they be used to create
Combat Manuals.
Select the Forma you want to add.
Removes all merges and Sacred Seals.

Use Forma Souls to gain
a Forma unit as your ally?

・ The Forma unit gained as an ally
will lose all merges and Sacred Seals.
・ Forma cannot be used as the
source for merges or Inherit Skill.
・ Forma cannot be used to create
Combat Manuals.

Forma Allies will be available
for a limited time after the Hall
of Forms concludes.

You can use Forma Souls to gain
Forma units as your allies.

You need additional Forma Souls
to add this ally to your army.

After purchase, you can claim your
Forma Souls from the Present List.

An enigmatic treasure used to transform Forma
units into allies by imbuing them with souls.

$a· Purchased Orbs and Forma Souls
  can be used only on devices with
  $a0 operating systems.
No Combat Manuals can be compiled.

$aCompiling this Combat Manual will
use $a0 items.
Do you want to proceed?

$aTo compile this Combat Manual,
you must first acquire additional
$a0 items.

Compiling Combat Manuals:
You can use Divine Codes to
compile Combat Manuals.

There are two types of Combat
Manuals that can be compiled,
Normal and Limited-Time.

Limited-Time Combat Manuals:
Divine Code: Ephemera items are
used to compile Combat Manuals
within a limited time frame. After
time is up, such codes are lost.
(Ephemera can be obtained from
various sources and events.)

Normal Combat Manuals:
Divine Code: Part X items can be
used to compile Combat Manuals.
They can be obtained from
sources like Mjölnir's Strike, the
Arena, and Aether Raids.

Ordered Compiling:
Normal Combat Manuals must be
completed and unlocked in order,
starting with the leftmost manual.

Once the leftmost manual has
been compiled, the next can be
compiled (proceeding right).

You have reached the Combat Manual
limit and cannot compile any more.
